meanings.definition: Involving a burdensome or oppressive task or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The heavy backpack felt onerous on my shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The long and tiring journey was truly onerous for the hikers.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those books home was an onerous task, but at least it counted as exercise!
meanings.sent4: The weight of her expectations was an onerous burden that he struggled to bear.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending paperwork made the office feel like an onerous prison.

meanings.sent1: The scorching heat made the hike onerous for the tired travelers.
meanings.sent2: The loss of a loved one can be an onerous experience to go through.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle work and school can feel like an onerous balancing act.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his secrets became an onerous burden that he carried alone.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending rain made the outdoor event an onerous affair.
